title: Bures metric
summary: In mathematics, in the area of quantum information geometry, the Bures metric (named after Donald Bures)[1] or Helstrom metric (named after Carl W. Helstrom)[2] defines an infinitesimal distance between density matrix operators defining quantum states. It is a quantum generalization of the Fisher information metric, and is identical to the Fubiniâ€“Study metric[3] when restricted to the pure states alone.
